channel.title: Jonathan Peacher
channel.copyright: Made with by Jonathan Peacher

item.title: Immune Part 1: Meet Your Immune System
item.description: If you’d like to read the whole thing yourself and support the author, you can buy the book (not affiliated): https://sites.prh.com/immune What is the Immune System? 3.5 billion years ago, cells figured out how to gather resources by leeching off of other cells. 541 million years ago, multicellular life formed and developed systems to defend against intruders. While we can’t directly analyze ancient immune systems, we can study it via the tree of life.

item.title: Now
item.description: This is a now page, and if you have your own site, you should make one, too. Life I live in Austin, TX with my fiancée and our 4 cats (Cisco, Sammy, Milo, & Remy)! My fiancée and I have been together for 6 years and we are finally getting married this December! We’ve been trying to work out more and we’ve made some progress. This year so far we have logged 24 workouts!

item.title: What Am I?
item.description: I am someone who generally writes code using web-based technologies. What am I? This question has bugged me for years and I think I’ve finally come to a conclusion. If you like spoilers, look at my home page or the conclusion below. If not, here is my breakdown. Keep in mind that there exists many more titles than I mention below, but I am just trying to focus on my field.

item.title: New Computer Who Dis?
item.description: Install Command Line Tools xcode-select --install Oh My Zsh sh -c "$(curl -fsSL https://raw.github.com/ohmyzsh/ohmyzsh/master/tools/install.sh)" Homebrew /bin/bash -c "$(curl -fsSL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Homebrew/install/HEAD/install.sh)" pyenv node (need to consider a package manager) Applications Visual Studio Code Docker 1Password Things 3 iStat Menus 6 Magnet Bandwidth+ Progress

item.title: About
item.description: My name is Jonathan Peacher and I'm a Software Engineer. This is my little corner of the internet where you can find out what I'm doing now, view my code, read my posts, review my resume, and get in contact! This site is hosted on GitHub and built by Hugo with the simple-hugo theme I made using Simple.css. Stats for nerds

item.title: Resume
item.description: summary { font-weight: normal; } Experience Software Engineer Texas Advanced Computing Center, Jan 2018 - Present Developed web applications utilized by over 9000 K12 admins, teachers, and students. Streamlined many aspects of managing our registration platform, allowing staff members to focus on empowering K12 CS educators instead of wrestling with systems. Built a cyber range portal from scratch that allows hundreds of students to participate in cybersecurity exercises in a safe environment.
